name: Enterprise
description: Large enterprise customers with 1000+ employees. Rackspace serves over 81,000 customers across 120 countries with 400+ quota-bearing sales representatives per FY2024 10-K. Enterprise is the primary go-to-market focus evidenced by Fortune 100 customer references (Seattle Children's Hospital, Wyndham Hotels, Coinstar, Volkswagen, ExxonMobil, Walmart, UnitedHealth Group) and dedicated strategic client executives per partner program page.

name: Mid-Market
description: Mid-size companies with 100-999 employees. Rackspace explicitly positions as serving mid-market customers alongside enterprise per channel partners page statement that company excels in serving mid-market and enterprise customers. Recognized as Leader in Everest Group Cloud Services for Mid-market Enterprises Peak Matrix Assessment 2025. Mid-market focus reinforced by t-shirt-sized fixed-cost assessment offerings per PE partnership page.

name: Small Business
description: Small businesses with fewer than 100 employees. Rackspace Email at $10/mailbox and Cloud Office services serve small business segment. AppsRunTheWorld data indicates 85.47% of Rackspace Cloud customers are organizations with 0-100 employees. Historical origin as web hosting provider for SMBs before evolution to managed cloud services. Rackspace Webmail and Cloud Office Control Panel serve this segment directly.

name: Healthcare
description: Healthcare providers, health systems, life sciences and pharmaceutical organizations. Dedicated industry page at rackspace.com/industry/healthcare with Rackspace Healthcare Cloud brand. Named as one of largest third-party Epic hosting providers with 99.999% uptime for EHR workloads per partner page. Recognized as Leader in Frost Radar Healthcare Enterprise Cloud Managed Services Providers 2024 and Major Contender in Everest Group Healthcare Industry Cloud Peak Matrix 2024. AWS Healthcare Competency holder. ViVE 2026 conference exhibitor. Customer reference: Seattle Children's Hospital, Compass Healthcare (AI Launchpad case study).

name: Government and Public Sector
description: US federal agencies, state and local governments, defense organizations and government SaaS vendors. Dedicated solution pages at rackspace.com/industry/government and rackspace.com/fedramp. Rackspace Government Cloud (RGC) holds FedRAMP Moderate JAB authorization since 2015 plus DoD Impact Level 4 and DFARS/CMMC attestations. Powers solutions supporting more than half of Federal Cabinet-level agencies. FISMA, ITAR, Section 889, HIPAA and IRS Publication 1075 compliant. UK Public Sector listed as separate industry page. AWS Public Sector Partner designation.

name: Financial Services
description: Banking, insurance, capital markets and fintech organizations. Listed as explicit vertical on Dell Technologies partnership page (Banking and Financial Services as separate items). AWS Financial Services Competency holder. SaaS optimization page confirms industry-specific knowledge across financial services. AppsRunTheWorld data indicates Insurance as one of top three concentrated customer industries for Rackspace Cloud. PCI DSS Level 1 Service Provider certification supports payment card processing requirements.

name: Retail and E-Commerce
description: Retail, e-commerce and consumer-facing digital commerce organizations. Dedicated industry page at rackspace.com/industry/retail. AWS Retail Competency holder. AppsRunTheWorld data identifies Retail as the most concentrated customer industry for Rackspace Cloud. Digital agency partner program supports e-commerce platforms including Adobe/Magento, Sitecore and Oracle Commerce per business partnerships page. Customer references include Walmart per AppsRunTheWorld.

name: Manufacturing
description: Discrete and process manufacturing, industrial and automotive organizations. Dedicated industry page at rackspace.com/industry/manufacturing focused on process automation efficiency and cost reduction. Supported applications include SAP and Oracle per Dell partnership page. AWS Industrial Software Competency holder. GlobalData confirms automotive as listed industry vertical. Customer references include General Motors and NVIDIA per ZoomInfo data. Niterra partnership for Google Cloud migration announced December 2025.

name: SaaS and ISV
description: Software-as-a-Service companies and independent software vendors building cloud-native applications. Dedicated industry page at rackspace.com/industry/saas-isv. AWS SaaS Competency holder. Portfolio supports full product lifecycle from concept to QA to production per SaaS ISV page. RISC product specifically targets ISVs selling SaaS to federal government for FedRAMP ATO acceleration. Global data centers deliver speed and reliability on managed network with proprietary routing technology for SaaS workloads.

name: Energy and Utilities
description: Oil and gas, energy production and utilities organizations. Dedicated industry page at rackspace.com/industry/oil-gas focused on next-generation monitoring, inspection and safety advancements. GlobalData confirms oil and gas as listed Rackspace industry vertical. ZoomInfo lists Energy, Utilities and Waste Treatment as customer concentration industry. AI Launchpad positions private cloud AI for energy sector use cases per November 2025 announcement.

name: Education
description: Higher education institutions, K-12 school districts and education technology providers. Dedicated industry page at rackspace.com/industry/education focused on leveraging latest technologies while addressing security and compliance requirements. AWS Education Competency holder. Customer evaluations include Louisiana State University and Toronto Metropolitan University per AppsRunTheWorld data.

name: Travel and Hospitality
description: Hotels, airlines, travel agencies, restaurants and hospitality organizations. Dedicated industry page at rackspace.com/industry/travel-hospitality. AWS Travel and Hospitality Competency holder. GlobalData confirms travel and hospitality as listed Rackspace industry vertical. Customer reference: Wyndham Hotels and Resorts (SDDC Solutions case study with quote from Global Head of Technology and Services).

name: Food and Beverage
description: Food production, beverage manufacturing and agricultural technology organizations. Dedicated industry page at rackspace.com/industry/food-beverage focused on cloud streamlining of operations for big-picture growth. Customer reference: Reiter Affiliated Companies (RAC), one of world's largest fresh berry producers (private cloud case study with CIO quote about knowledge-sharing across geography and ranches).

name: Private Equity Portfolio Companies
description: Portfolio companies of private equity firms requiring cloud optimization, cost reduction and digital transformation. Dedicated partnership page at rackspace.com/partners/private-equity with named Executive Relationship Manager, PE Alliance Executive Sponsor and assigned Strategic Client Executives. Offers M&A due diligence through PE Professional Services team. Recognized as Major Contender in Everest Group Private Equity IT Services Peak Matrix 2024. Preferred pricing models and fixed-cost t-shirt-sized assessments for portfolio companies.

name: Media and Entertainment
description: Streaming platforms, broadcast, gaming publishers, and digital media companies. Rackspace explicitly lists Media and Entertainment as a named vertical on their website, with use cases around content delivery, video transcoding on AWS and Azure, and audience analytics. ObjectRocket (MongoDB) was heavily used in this sector before its divestiture.

name: Life Sciences and Pharmaceuticals
description: Pharmaceutical manufacturers, CROs, biotech firms, and medical device companies. Rackspace 10-K and website list Life Sciences as a distinct vertical. HIPAA-eligible services and GxP-compliant managed cloud offerings are positioned here. AWS Life Sciences competency and regulatory workload migration experience cited.

name: Telecommunications
description: Telco operators, cable MSOs, and wireless carriers modernizing BSS/OSS workloads on public cloud. Rackspace Onica (acquired 2019) had telecom vertical depth. Network automation, DevSecOps on AWS, and cloud-native 5G app development cited in case studies.

name: Aerospace and Defense
description: Defense contractors, federal integrators, and aerospace manufacturers requiring ITAR-compliant and FedRAMP-authorized cloud environments. Reston Federal Government Office (site-002) and Rackspace Government Cloud (FedRAMP Authorized) directly serve this segment. DoD IL2/IL4 workloads documented in public certifications.

name: Professional and Business Services
description: Consulting firms, law firms, accounting practices, and staffing companies adopting cloud collaboration and data platforms. Microsoft 365 Managed and Google Workspace Managed products specifically target this segment. Rackspace Email and Apps legacy base concentrated here.

name: Transportation and Logistics
description: Freight carriers, 3PLs, airlines, and last-mile delivery platforms with high-volume transactional and IoT workloads. AWS IoT, real-time analytics on Redshift, and multi-cloud connectivity cited in Rackspace partner case studies. Fortna (PE-backed logistics automation) represents a known customer archetype.

name: Gaming and Digital Entertainment
description: Game studios, esports platforms, and interactive media companies with burst-intensive compute and global low-latency requirements. Rackspace Flex Metal (bare metal on demand) and GPU cloud offerings directly target game rendering and multiplayer infrastructure. AWS GameTech partner designation applies.

name: Nonprofit and Social Sector
description: Foundations, NGOs, and mission-driven organizations accessing cloud infrastructure at scale. Rackspace participates in AWS Nonprofit Credit Program partner ecosystem. Lower margin segment but provides reference diversity and social impact reporting value.

name: Digital Native / Born-in-Cloud
description: Startups and scale-ups that have never run on-premises infrastructure, primarily on AWS, Azure, or GCP. Rackspace Elastic Engineering and Rackspace Spot (previously ObjectRocket) targeted this cohort. High growth, high churn, price-sensitive but strong reference value. Rackspace Accelerator program documented for this segment.

name: Federal Government / FedRAMP
description: U.S. federal civilian and DoD agencies requiring FedRAMP-authorized cloud services and IL-compliant managed operations. Rackspace Government Cloud achieved FedRAMP authorization. Separate go-to-market motion from commercial government (seg-005), dedicated compliance team, dedicated sales force out of Reston office.

name: Global Systems Integrator Channel
description: Large GSIs (Accenture, Deloitte, Infosys, Wipro, Cognizant) that embed Rackspace managed services in their cloud transformation delivery. Rackspace explicitly lists GSI co-sell agreements in 10-K partner ecosystem disclosures. Channel revenue contribution estimated 15-20% of total bookings based on analyst research.

name: ISV and SaaS Platform
description: Independent software vendors and SaaS companies hosting multi-tenant platforms on Rackspace-managed cloud. Distinct from seg-009 (SaaS and ISV combined); this segment focuses on hosting/ops buyers rather than app buyers. Rackspace SaaS Accelerate program and AWS ISV Accelerate partner path documented. High infrastructure consumption, technical buyers, strong upsell to professional services.
